quotes.quote: I have been loving you a little more every minute since this morning.
Do not save your loving speeches for your friends till they are dead. Do not write them on their tombstones, speak them rather now instead.
I must confess, as the experience of my own soul, that the expectation of loving my friends in heaven principally kindles my love to them while on earth.

The most I can do for my friend is simply to be his friend. I have no wealth to bestow on him. If he knows that I am happy in loving him, he will want no other reward. Is not friendship divine in this?
Surely great loving-kindness yet may go With a little gift: all's dear that comes from friends.
Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage.
One is loved because one is loved. No reason is needed for loving.
To love for the sake of being loved is human, but to love for the sake of loving is angelic.
Even if loving meant leaving, or solitude, or sorrow, love was worth every penny of its price.
Do you have to have a reason for loving?
Loving someone can be hard at times. You risk a lot when you love - your heart and soul, at the least. Love is the most important and most rewarding investment you can make in another person.
It is an absolute human certainty that no one can know his own beauty or perceive a sense of his own worth until it has been reflected back to him in the mirror of another loving, caring human being.
The degree of loving is measured by the degree of giving.
There is no limit to the power of loving.
Loving is not just looking at each other, it's looking in the same direction.
It is by loving and by being loved that one can come nearest to the soul of another.
Friends show their love in times of trouble, not in happiness.
Can miles truly separate you from friends... If you want to be with someone you love, aren't you already there?
Trust no friend without faults, and love a maiden, but no angel.
A friend is one who knows you and loves you just the same.
Greater love has no one than this, than to lay down one's life for his friends.
Sooner or later you've heard all your best friends have to say. Then comes the tolerance of real love.

It is one of the severest tests of friendship to tell your friend his faults. So to love a man that you cannot bear to see a stain upon him, and to speak painful truth through loving words, that is friendship.
would consider him definitely one of my very best friends and I know he feels the same about me. We have a lot of love and respect.
The more we love our friends, the less we flatter them; it is by excusing nothing that pure love shows itself.
Consult your friend on all things, especially on those which respect yourself. His counsel may then be useful where your own self-love might impair your judgment.
Get not your friends by bare compliments, but by giving them sensible tokens of your love.
When your love contracts in anger, the atmosphere itself feels threatening. But when you're expansive, no matter what the weather, you're in an open, windy field with friends.
Love your friends as if they would some day hate you.
Nobody who is afraid of laughing, and heartily too, at his friend, can be said to have a true and thorough love for him.
